content.description: Sit start on the positive low ledge and head straight up through thin holds to the underclings under the upper face. Pull through to the top of the wall.
content.location: Just right of Jolly Roger, but left of Flexin Texan. The crack is off.

content.description: Sit start in the low baseball-sized hueco. Move right into the flake/undercling. Follow the pockets up the thin seam to the ledge before the vein of loose rock. Going to the top is trivial.
content.location: First problem after the slab to the right of Swiss High/Low. The wall extends about 15 feet right to the arete.

content.description: Sit Start at the base of the large flake That runs from the ground to the top of the wall. (Prominent feature on the Bow.) Follow the flake to the top of the wall. BEWARE: The obvious jug mid-way up the route is loose. Please avoid using it. There is also loose rock in the crack near the top.
content.location: Prominent Flake in the center of Fiesta Wall.

content.description: Sit start right hand in the good small hueco close to the arete on the right side of the Bow. Use the ledge/thin seam for the left. Head straight up through the old rusty hanger to the top of the wall, finishing on the flint blocks.
content.location: Furthest right side of the Bow before the arete.

content.description: Starts after the slab wash just right of The Swiss route starting hueco, and continues to the prominent arete that separates the left wall and right wall. Just before the dihedral on The right wall.
